definition: to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
to pull/to draw/to pull back/to withdraw/to flash past

sentences.english: He was so eager to get to the game that he burned up the road all the way.
sentences.chinese: 他急于赶去看比赛，所以一路上风驰电掣般地开车。

sentences.english: The development speed of Internet new media always is like greased lightning kind.
sentences.chinese: 互联网新媒体的发展速度总是风驰电掣般。

sentences.english: The motorcyclist had gone like a blue streak toward Baker Street.
sentences.chinese: 这名骑摩托车的人已经风驰电掣地骑向贝克街。

sentences.english: We found him a nice horse — a good mover who could gallop.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现他是匹好马，跑起来风驰电掣。

sentences.english: I looked in my mirror and saw a car flying like a bat out of hell.
sentences.chinese: 我看向后视镜，看到一辆车风驰电掣的飞驰而来。

sentences.english: I was rushed to the hospital by ambulance.
sentences.chinese: 救护车风驰电掣把我送到了医院。

definition: proceeding at a tremendous pace/getting on like a house on fire
to whistle past/to hurtle past/to zip by
lit. a meteor catching up with the moon/swift action (idiom)
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
